posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
Does the VH-109 have the capability to statically map a Mac address to an IP? We have logic in our code to automatically upload settings to photon vision via the API on code start to make sure the settings haven’t been modified before a match. This works using the hostname or IP, this year we used the hostname to allow the use of DHCP. We ran into an interesting issue this year (as well as last year, though much less often) where PV randomly reset itself and the host name was back to factory defaults and then the settings upload didn’t work. Even last year when we did this with the static IP, when PV reset so did the networking and same issue. It’d be nice to be able to make sure the radio assigned the same IP to each PI via DHCP that way if the issue occurred, the settings would apply even when reset.

If this doesn’t currently exist, could it be added for next year?

posts.name: Craig Schardt
posts.cooked: Not an answer to your question, but would you please open an issue on GitHub · Where software is built about this? If PhotonVision is resetting on it’s own, that could be a bug. Please include a description of what you observed when PhotonVision reset and  logs so we can look into what might be causing this.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: I can but I don’t have any of that data to provide. It happened only a few of times this past year, 1-2 during events so pressed for time to get back and running.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked:
The VH-109 does not support DHCP address reservation.

But to achieve what you want you’ll want to configure each Pi with a static IP (10.TE. AM .6 - 10.TE. AM .19)

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
legoguy1000:

Even last year when we did this with the static IP, when PV reset so did the networking and same issue.

FletcherS7:

But to achieve what you want you’ll want to configure each Pi with a static IP (10.TE. AM .6 - 10.TE. AM .19)

I think the OP is saying when they experience the reset, the static IP is reset back to DHCP on the Pi (or whatever co-processor) as well.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: ya. I honestly don’t remember last year when we did use statics but I seem to remember that it all reset including the IPs

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: @kiettyyyy apologies for the direct tag but was hoping you could advise or maybe add this feature to ur summer backlog?

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked:
That’s sounds like a bigger problem with your co-processor that warrants investigation. I would open an issue on the Photon Vision GitHub
